pullRequest.body:
`LinearEquiv.congrQuadraticMap` matches `LinearMap.compQuadraticMap`, while `LinearEquiv.congrRight₂` somewhat matches `LinearMap.compr₂`.

Used in  #14988

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3baf09a3ae](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17454/commits/3baf09a3aef05e70045d3fa3b139627ea0555f8f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrQuadraticMap`
`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrQuadraticMap_refl`
`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrQuadraticMap_symm`
`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrRight_symm`
`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrRight₂`
`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrRight₂_apply`
`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrRight₂_refl`
`+ _root_.LinearEquiv.congrRight₂_trans`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I'm not super happy with the naming, but I also don't have any better ideas.

Maybe another reviewer does!

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by eric-wieser.
If we're going to bikeshed over names then another possibility for `LinearMap.BilinForm.congr₂` would I guess be `LinearMap.BilinForm.congrRight`. But I'd be happy to merge either choice.

I think that would be rather confusing, because [`LinearMap.BilinForm.compRight`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/BilinearForm/Hom.html#LinearMap.BilinForm.compRight) sounds like it ought to be analogous, but is about the (right) domain rather than the codomain.

@eric-wieser For equivs, `congrRight` is in fact about the codomain: e.g. [LinearEquiv.congrRight](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Equiv/Basic.html#LinearEquiv.congrRight)
So, is the consensus for `LinearMap.BilinForm.congrRight`? I've pushed a commit with that.

> @eric-wieser For equivs, `congrRight` is in fact about the codomain: e.g. [LinearEquiv.congrRight](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Equiv/Basic.html#LinearEquiv.congrRight)


I would argue this is not about Equivs, but about linear maps; that is, you get the definition in this PR by swapping `LinearMap` with `BilinMap`, not by swapping `LinearEquiv` with` BilinMap`.

So I guess you could go with `LinearEquiv.congrRight₂` which is a little bit like the non-equivalence version `LinearMap.compr₂`.

> you get the definition in this PR by swapping `LinearMap` with `BilinMap`, not by swapping `LinearEquiv` with` BilinMap`.

I'm afraid this has been going on for so long I have no recollection of where I adapted it from now.

@eric-wieser is this what you mean?

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17454/commits/ecc76192283f364be42a44e2885910ff8b26a7d4

Yes, that's what I meant. @jcommelin, are you happy with those?

bors d=@jcommelin

:v: jcommelin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
@jcommelin are you able to merge this PR now please?
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11492821881/job/31987506241)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11492821881/job/31987506688)
Could you add these for the bilinear version too?
Done, thanks.

Do we have a the non-equiv spelling of this? If so, a lemma linking then would be good.

(In the quadratic case `simps` I believe generates such a lemma, but I will check more closely when I'm next at lean)

`@[simps!?]` outputs:
```
[simps.verbose] adding projection LinearMap.BilinForm.LinearMap.BilinMap.congr₂_symm_apply_apply_apply:
      ∀ {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : CommSemiring R] [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
        {N₁ : Type u_9} {N₂ : Type u_10} [inst_3 : AddCommMonoid N₁] [inst_4 : AddCommMonoid N₂] [inst_5 : Module R N₁]
        [inst_6 : Module R N₂] (e : N₁ ≃ₗ[R] N₂) (f : M →ₗ[R] M →ₗ[R] N₂) (a a_1 : M),
        (((LinearMap.BilinForm.LinearMap.BilinMap.congr₂ e).symm f) a) a_1 = e.symm ((f a) a_1) 

[simps.verbose] adding projection LinearMap.BilinForm.LinearMap.BilinMap.congr₂_apply_apply_apply:
      ∀ {R : Type u_1} {M : Type u_2} [inst : CommSemiring R] [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
        {N₁ : Type u_9} {N₂ : Type u_10} [inst_3 : AddCommMonoid N₁] [inst_4 : AddCommMonoid N₂] [inst_5 : Module R N₁]
        [inst_6 : Module R N₂] (e : N₁ ≃ₗ[R] N₂) (f : M →ₗ[R] M →ₗ[R] N₁) (a a_1 : M),
        (((LinearMap.BilinForm.LinearMap.BilinMap.congr₂ e) f) a) a_1 = e ((f a) a_1) 
```
Right, that's what I was afraid of. I added the missing lemma.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `LinearEquiv.congrQuadraticMap` and `LinearEquiv.congrRight₂`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(LinearAlgebra/BilinearForm/TensorProduct): Tensor products of bilinear maps
